tweets.text:
BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t

We‚Äôve used our powers of entry at the River Lugg #Herefordshire incident

14 specialist officers from @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil now on site gathering information & evidence. https://t.co/LLCOFQHCox

Take a look at flooding at exact site early this year (see video) When the land floods now massive soil erosion, landowner will lose land, people downstream could be inundated with mud. @EnvAgency need to prepare now!! #RiverLugg #Herefordshire 3/3 https://t.co/CcLkHBcwGP
Thank you @EnvAgency please keep at it. It's a shocking tragedy but if proper action is taken it could deter others who think it's somehow ok to rip up habitats like this. https://t.co/4UllZ5an3m

"Be in no doubt that anything less than a prosecution and full restoration of the river, paid for by the perpetrator, will be acceptable‚Äù.

@EnvAgency and others want to prove they are fit for the 21st century? Here's your chance. https://t.co/ji0wmcYyhf

A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

urls.title: Horror at destruction of nationally important UK river | Herefordshire Wildlife Trust
urls.description: Major damage to River Lugg in Herefordshire will be test case for Government commitment to strengthen wildlife protection.

tweets.text:
This is so sad to see https://t.co/qke2SrWuIG 

A wonderful river habitat trashed. It shows the importance of strong commitments from Government on compliance & regulation to protect our environment for future generations @HerefordshireWT @DefraGovUK @EnvAgencySW @BritishCanoeing

domain.name: Interests and Hobbies Category
domain.description: A grouping of interests and hobbies entities, like Novelty Food or Destinations

tweets.text: We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Well done - EA Drone operator surveying damage at River Lugg at Kingsland site this afternoon - picture editors more at Alamy Live News @guardian @guardianphotos #riverlugg @TelegraphPics https://t.co/SBFVor1VIu

.@EnvAgencyMids is calling for those responsible for stripping away trees from a mile of the River Lugg to be prosecuted. 
@HerefordshireWT says decades of damage has been done, destroying an important habitat for fish, birds and mammals. https://t.co/8NHPrlu2m9
@EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Can you confirm exactly when the @EnvAgency were informed about this incident?

Day 4 of reducing plastic at Christmas - Give reusable gifts such as a reusable coffee cup, soap container or water bottle! üéÅ Did you know that 50% of all plastic produced is used for single-use products? üò¨ @EnvAgency https://t.co/7PKPpsUEx7

tweets.text: @AmyJaneBeer @HerefordshireWT Tonne of bricks - and then the rest of the wall. @EnvAgency needs to respond in a way that makes ecological vandalism of this nature untenable - ie. can't be easily shrugged off with a fine that has already been factored into the calculations.
Five years since #StormDesmond hit #Cumbria, new flood defences are offering better protection to at least 2,000 properties according to the @EnvAgencyNW. https://t.co/RN7hvKsjQV

Exciting update! Salmon redds now spotted in this restored channel (previously none). üêü Plus woody debris slowing the flow after storms and  creating wonderfully complex habitats throughout the floodplain. 
Thanks again to @EnvAgencyNW @NTWestLakes Gosforth Anglers https://t.co/egBQabE4ne
